action.action-desc: Mr. Duffy introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to expand the H–2A worker program to include certain additional laborers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defending the Agricultural Industry’s Requirements Year-round Act of 2017 or as the DAIRY Act of 2017.

section.header: Expansion of H–2A worker program to include certain additional laborers
section.text: Section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a)) is amended by inserting after abandoning the following: who is coming temporarily to the United States to perform agricultural labor or services as a dairy worker, or.

section.header: Special rule for period of admission of H–2A nonimmigrants employed as sheepherders or dairy workers
section.text: Section 218(h) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1188(h)) is amended by adding at the end of the following:

paragraph.text: In the case of an alien admitted as an H–2A worker for employment as a dairy worker—

subparagraph.text: the initial period of admission shall be for a period of 18 months;
the period of admission may be extended for additional periods of 18 months; and
no period of absence from the United States may be required as a condition of approval of an extension under subparagraph (B).
